title: Virtual Assistant (Philippines) — GoHighLevel (GHL) Funnel Builder + Digital Product Support (Part-Time)
description:
Overview



I’m starting a media business that creates and sells digital products online (eBooks, online courses, and other multimedia products). I’m hiring a Virtual Assistant based in the Philippines to help build and manage my sales funnels and product websites in GoHighLevel (GHL).



? GoHighLevel proficiency is the #1 requirement.

I have limited experience in GHL, so I need someone who can confidently work on the platform and collaborate with me as we build and improve our sales channels.

________________________________________

Core Responsibilities (Primary) — GoHighLevel (GHL)

• Build funnels, landing pages, and product pages in GHL

• Set up forms, calendars, pipelines, CRM organization, and contact tagging

• Create basic workflows/automations (triggers, tags,
/SMS sequences as needed)

• Connect and test links, embeds, integrations, and page flow (troubleshooting)

• Help turn product ideas into live sales pages + checkout/lead capture flows

• Keep things organized and documented (simple SOPs/checklists)

________________________________________

Additional Support (Secondary)

• Online research and quick learning of new tools/apps

• Light formatting and organization for content and documents

• Assist with templates and basic admin tasks as needed

________________________________________

Required Qualifications

• Strong, hands-on experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) (funnels/pages + basic automations)

title: Amazon Store Manager
description:
Job Description:



We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Amazon Store Manager to join our team. You will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing our Amazon store operations to drive sales, enhance customer experience, and increase profitability. The ideal candidate is well-versed in Amazon marketplace dynamics, possesses excellent analytical skills, and has a proven track record of managing successful e-commerce stores.



Key Responsibilities:



Store Operations: Manage end-to-end Amazon store operations, including product listings, inventory management, pricing strategies, and order fulfillment. Ensure the store is compliant with Amazon's policies and guidelines.



Sales and Revenue Optimization: Implement strategies to increase sales, conversion rates, and overall revenue. Analyze sales data, customer behavior, and market trends to identify opportunities for growth.



Customer Experience: Monitor and enhance customer satisfaction ratings and reviews.



Marketing and Promotion: Develop and execute marketing campaigns, promotions, and advertising strategies to increase product visibility and attract more customers. Monitor the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and adjust strategies as needed. Must be fast and have proven strategies for how to implement various PPC campaigns.



Competitor Analysis: Stay updated on competitors' activities, pricing strategies, and product offerings. Use this information to make data-driven decisions and maintain a competitive edge.



Data Analysis and Reporting: Utilize various analytics tools to analyze sales data, track key performance indicators, and generate insightful reports. Use data-driven insights to optimize store performance and make informed business decisions.



Requirements:



Proven experience managing an Amazon store and driving significant sales growth.

In-depth knowledge of Amazon marketplace policies, algorithms, and best practices.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and extract actionable insights.

Proficiency in using analytics tools and e-commerce platforms.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Excellent excel skills

Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently.

Ability to adapt to changing market trends and implement innovative strategies.

Previous remote work experience and proficiency in remote collaboration tools.

If you are interested, please send your resume and portfolio to

description:
About the Role:

We are a growing portfolio of online media brands serving engaged audiences across meaningful niches including mental health, personal development, and wellness. Our digital newsletters reach hundreds of thousands of readers daily, delivering valuable content that helps people live better lives.



We're looking for an organized, detail-oriented Project Manager to oversee the production of our digital

products. This is a part-time to full-time position (with potential to grow) perfect for someone who thrives on

keeping projects moving, enjoys working with creative freelancers, and has an eagle eye for quality.





You'll be the central point of contact between our team and our network of freelance designers—ensuring

What You’ll Be Doing:

1. Project Pipeline Management

• Release new projects from the backlog and announce availability to the freelancer pool

• Assign projects to appropriate designers based on skills, availability, and workload

• Monitor project timelines and ensure deadlines are met

2. Quality Control & Feedback

• Review all submitted design files (PDFs, Canva files, source files) for quality and accuracy

• Ensure all checklist items are completed before sign-off

3. Freelancer Coordination

• Communicate with freelancers via Trello comments and WhatsApp group announcements

• Answer questions, clarify briefs, and provide guidance as needed

• Follow up on overdue projects and manage deadline extensions

• Onboard new freelancers to our workflow and systems

4. Administrative Duties

• Track project statuses and maintain organized records

• Coordinate payment processing (weekly/bi-weekly schedules)

• Flag issues, bottlenecks, or underperforming freelancers to leadership

• Continuously improve workflows and documentation



Requirements:

• 2+ years of experience in project management, production coordination, or traffic management

• Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

• Strong written communication skills (clear, professional, and friendly)

• Experience working with freelancers or remote creative teams

• Familiarity with Trello (or similar project management tools)

• Ability to review design files and provide actionable feedback

• Self-motivated and comfortable working independently

• Reliable internet connection and availability during core business hours



Ideal Candidate:

• Background in graphic design, print production, or digital products

• Experience with Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design tools

• Familiarity with print-ready file specifications

• Previous experience managing high-volume, fast-turnaround projects





Work Details:

Hours:  Part-time (15–25 hrs/week) with potential to grow to full-time

Location: Remote

Schedule: Flexible, but must be available for daily check-ins and 48-hour review turnarounds





Why Join Us?

- Flexible remote work — Work from anywhere on your schedule

- Growth potential — Start part-time with opportunity to expand

- Creative environment — Work alongside talented designers on diverse projects

- Streamlined systems — We have clear processes; you'll help make them even better

title: Policy Research Analyst (Public Policy)
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Policy Research Analyst to support in-depth legal and public policy research for a U.S.-based public policy client. This role is ideal for individuals with legal training and a strong understanding of American law, particularly those interested in state-level policy research with a focus on Idaho law.

In this role, you will conduct detailed legal and policy research, analyze legislation and regulatory developments, and produce clear, well-structured research outputs to support policy strategy and informed decision-making.



Remote Tuesday–Saturday | 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM (US Mountain Time)





Job duties and responsibilities:

 

       - Conduct comprehensive legal and policy research on federal, state, and local issues, with a strong emphasis on Idaho 

          statutes, regulations, case law, and administrative rules



        - Analyze proposed legislation, regulatory changes, and policy initiatives to assess legal, operational, and practical 

           implications



        - Prepare high-quality research memoranda, policy briefs, summaries, and talking points



        - Track legislative activity, agency actions, and relevant legal and regulatory developments



        - Provide research-backed insights to support public policy strategy and recommendations



        - Collaborate with internal teams on time-sensitive policy research requests



         - Assist with compliance-related research and analysis as needed



Qualifications



          - Legal training required (J.D. preferred; law students, paralegals, or legally trained policy professionals are encouraged 

            to apply)



          - Strong understanding of the U.S. legal system and constitutional principles



          - Demonstrated ability or strong interest in researching Idaho state law



          - Excellent legal research, analytical, and writing skills



          - Ability to synthesize complex legal and policy information into clear, accessible formats



          - Strong attention to detail and critical thinking skills



           - Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines independently



Preferred Experience



          - Background in public policy, government affairs, legislative research, or regulatory analysis



          - Familiarity with Idaho legislative processes and administrative agencies



          - Experience using legal research platforms (preferred but not required)



          - Experience in compliance, regulatory affairs, or government relations



If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:

To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "PolicyResearch" in the subject line of your
.

title: Cruise & Guest Services Virtual Assistant / Specialist
description:
Cruise & Guest Services Virtual Assistant / Specialist 



(Full-Time, Remote, EST) 



PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING 



$7/Hour Starting Rate | 40 Hours | Full-Time 



Opportunity for increases based on performance 



We are ONLY reviewing applications that meet the following criteria: 



Role Snapshot 



Full-time remote role focused on: 



Cruise booking coordination and related tasks — drafting client
s for review, calling Viking/partners (not guests), and maintaining HubSpot CRM and trackers. 



CEO and team support — administrative tasks across the booking lifecycle. 



Best fit if you're detail-driven, reliable, and want a long-term role with room to grow across departments. 



DO NOT APPLY if: 



You do not have hands-on experience in cruise guest services, itinerary management, or travel bookings. (General hospitality — bartending, waiting tables, retail — does not qualify. 



You submit template applications or generic resumes. 



You're seeking part-time, short-term, or freelance work. 



You cannot commit to U.S. Eastern Time business hours (9am–5pm EST). 



DO APPLY if: 



You have worked in cruise guest services (ocean or river) OR have strong experience managing travel itineraries and bookings with exceptional attention to detail. 



You are looking for a long-term, full-time remote role with a mission-driven, close-knit team that invests in your growth. 



You are professional, detail-oriented, and genuinely passionate about creating excellent travel experiences. 



You can work independently, follow documented processes, and ask questions when something is unclear. 



About Us 



We are a boutique travel agency based in Atlanta, GA (EST). We specialize in luxury river cruises — especially Viking — and offer white-glove support for discerning clients. 



We're warm, organized, and passionate about creating unforgettable cruise experiences. Our team is small, collaborative, and committed to doing things right. 



We have documented processes (SOPs) for most tasks — you won't be guessing. You'll be trained and supported, not thrown into the deep end. 



We're looking for a talented Virtual Assistant to join us full-time. 



Who We're Looking For 



Must-Have: 



Experience in cruise guest services, travel bookings, or itinerary management (Executive assistant experience with complex travel coordination may also qualify) 



Excellent written English with a warm, polished, professional tone 



Proven ability to work independently and manage detailed tasks remotely 



High attention to detail, follow-through, and accountability 



Reliable high-speed internet and a quiet workspace 



Bonus Points: 



Experience with Viking Cruises or river cruising 



Familiarity with the MyViking Travel Advisor Portal (MVJ) 



HubSpot CRM experience (or fast learner with CRMs) 



Familiarity with booking portals, invoices, or guest information systems 



Strong time management and comfort with documented SOPs 



Your Role 



As our Virtual Assistant, you'll be responsible for: 



Drafting client
s (hold reminders, confirmation, follow-ups, courtesy responses, answer inquiries) 



Updating HubSpot CRM and internal trackers — keeping booking statuses, contact details, and notes current 



Calling Viking Cruises and partners to verify information, request itineraries, or resolve booking questions 



Supporting the CEO and team with high-level administrative tasks 



Managing booking coordination from inquiry through post-travel follow-up 



Cross-training across departments (Flights, Finance, Gifts, Marketing) as you grow in the role 



Why this matters: Cross-training keeps your work interesting, builds a broader skill set, and opens paths to specialize or take on more responsibility over time. 



Important Workflow Clarification 



So expectations are clear: 



You'll work directly with our staff as internal support — not as an independent agent. 



Guest/client
s are drafts for review. 



You'll have autonomy for routine messages, with clear guidance on when to escalate (pricing, payments, sensitive situations). 



Some responses require an empathetic, reassuring tone; others follow standard templates. 



You'll be trained on our systems (HubSpot, booking trackers, Outlook) and supported by an experienced team invested in your success. 



Schedule 



Target hours: 9:00am to 5:00pm EST (this is evening/night shift in the Philippines — please confirm this works for you) 



Hours may vary based on business needs. 



Saturday coverage may be required later via rotation, but only once you are well trained. 



How to Apply 



Applications that don't follow these instructions will not be reviewed. We use this to assess attention to detail and genuine interest. 



Step 1: 



Send your application with the subject line or first sentence including the phrase: "Smooth Sailing" 



Step 2: 



Include a short cover letter or message that: 



Explains your relevant experience in cruise guest services or travel bookings 



Shares why you're passionate about river cruising or travel support 



Describes what excites you about working with a team like ours 



Includes your answers to these writing prompts (paste them in the message): 



Prompt A: 



"In 3–5 sentences, draft a polite
 reply to a client who says they don't want to move forward with the cruise currently on hold and would like to postpone to a later date." 



Prompt B (optional but encouraged): 



"In 2–3 sentences, draft a thank-you note to a client who just returned from their cruise and sent you photos." 



(Use a warm, conversational tone — the kind you'd use with a valued client you want to keep.) 



Step 3: 



Attach your CV or resume (if using Google Drive, ensure access is granted) 





We're excited to meet someone who cares about excellent travel service and wants to make a difference. 



If that's you — smooth sailing ahead.

You do not have experience in cruise guest services, itinerary management, or travel bookings (This means hands-on experience working with cruise guests or managing travel plans—not unrelated hospitality such as bartending, waiting tables, or general retail/service roles.)



You use template applications or submit generic resumes



You’re seeking part-time, short-term, or freelance work



DO APPLY if:

You have worked in cruise guest services (ocean or river) OR have strong experience managing travel itineraries and bookings with exceptional attention to detail



You are looking for a long-term, full-time remote role with a mission-driven, close-knit team



You are professional, detail-oriented, and passionate about creating excellent travel experiences



About Us

We are a boutique, all-female (so far!) travel agency based in Atlanta, GA (EST). We specialize in luxury river cruises—especially Viking—and offer white-glove support for discerning clients. We’re warm, organized, and passionate about creating unforgettable cruise experiences.



Now, we’re looking for a talented Virtual Assistant to join our remote team full-time.



Who We're Looking For

Must-Have:



Experience in cruise guest services, travel bookings, or itinerary management (if you have supported a senior executive, you may also apply) 



Excellent English (spoken and written) with a professional, polished tone



Proven ability to work independently and manage detailed tasks remotely



High attention to detail, follow-through, and accountability



Bonus Points:



Experience with Viking Cruises or river cruising knowledge



HubSpot CRM experience (or fast learner with other CRMs)



Strong time management and project organization skills



Your Role

As our Virtual Assistant, you’ll be responsible for:



Supporting our CEO with high-level administrative tasks



Managing cruise bookings from inquiry to post-travel follow-up



Communicating professionally with clients and cruise lines



Updating and organizing client data in HubSpot CRM



Coordinating meetings,
s, and important touchpoints



Ensuring every client feels supported, informed, and excited to travel



You’ll be trained and supported by an experienced team invested in your success. We’re building a long-term relationship and want this to be a role you love and grow into.



How to Apply

****Applications that don’t follow these instructions will not be reviewed.****

We use this to assess attention to detail and genuine interest.



Send your application with the subject line or first sentence including the phrase:

“Smooth Sailing”



Include a short cover letter or message that:



Explains your relevant experience in cruise guest services or travel bookings



Shares why you're passionate about River Cruising or travel support



Describes what excites you about working with a team like ours



Attach your CV or resume (if using Google Drive, ensure access is granted)



We’re excited to meet someone who cares about excellent travel service and wants to make a difference. If that’s you—smooth sailing ahead.

title: Cold Email Outreach Operator (End-to-End)
description:
Overview



Long-Term Growth Role

This is a part-time, long-term role designed to grow with the business. Compensation increases are tied to demonstrated ownership, autonomy, and impact — not tenure. As the business scales and your scope expands, pay will increase accordingly.



I run an early-stage content agency and need someone who can own cold
 outreach from zero to live campaigns. This is not a beginner role. This is not a generic VA or assistant role. This is a specialist operator role for someone who has already run cold
 systems end-to-end.



Your job is to design, execute, and optimize cold
 campaigns that book qualified sales calls while maintaining excellent deliverability. You must be capable of handling cold
 from zero to live campaigns without hand-holding.



In plain English: You own the cold
 channel. You identify who to target, build the lists, set up the infrastructure, write the sequences, launch the campaigns, and optimize for results. If you do your job well, I should think about cold
 *less*, not more.



Time Commitment: This is a part-time role averaging 10-20 hours per week. Time fluctuates: higher intensity during setup and iteration phases (15-20 hours), lower ongoing time once systems are stable (10-15 hours). You're paid for ownership, results, and reliability—not hours worked.



This role owns cold
 execution, not overall growth strategy or sales leadership. You're expected to figure things out independently and take ownership of outcomes, not just complete tasks.



Core Responsibilities



ICP & Targeting:

- Identify and define the Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) based on business goals

- Think strategically about targeting, not just "send more
s"

- Source and scrape high-quality lead lists aligned with the ICP



Infrastructure & Setup:

- Set up and manage
 infrastructure (domains, inboxes, warm-up understanding)

- Understand and implement deliverability best practices (DNS, SPF, DKIM, warming, volume control)

- Set up campaigns inside Instantly (mandatory tool)

- Use Apollo, Clay, Smartlead, or similar tools as needed



Campaign Execution:

- Write, test, and iterate cold
 sequences (no spam, no gimmicks)

- Launch and manage multiple campaigns simultaneously

- Maintain deliverability as the #1 priority at all times—never compromise it

- Handle inbox replies and route qualified leads to booking



Optimization & Reporting:

- Monitor and improve open rates, reply rates, positive reply rates, and booking rates

- Track performance and report results clearly

- Identify bottlenecks and optimize campaigns independently



The goal: I should be able to give you a business goal and trust that you'll build, launch, and optimize cold
 campaigns that book qualified calls—without me managing the process or thinking about deliverability.



Non-Negotiables



Proven Experience (Required):

- Hands-on experience running cold
 campaigns end-to-end

- Deep understanding of deliverability (DNS, SPF, DKIM, warming, volume control)

- Experience with Instantly (mandatory)

- Experience with Apollo, Clay, Smartlead, or similar tools

- Track record of maintaining deliverability while scaling campaigns

- Zero tolerance for burning domains or reckless scaling



Skills & Mindset (Required):

- Strong written English (you're writing
s that get replies)

- Ability to think strategically about ICP and targeting

- High ownership and accountability

- Comfortable working with minimal oversight

- Ability to figure things out independently



What We're NOT Looking For:

- Beginners who want to learn cold

- Generic VAs or assistants

- People who only know theory, not execution

- People who need step-by-step instructions

- People who can't maintain deliverability

- Freelancers looking for hourly work

- People who prioritize speed over deliverability



Success Metrics



Primary Outcomes:

- Booked calls (primary outcome)

- Deliverability health maintained (never compromised)

- Reply rate and positive reply rate

- Open rate



By day 30, you should be:

- Running live campaigns with healthy deliverability

- Booking qualified sales calls consistently

- Maintaining open rates above industry benchmarks

- Reporting results clearly and proactively



The test: Can I give you a business goal and trust you'll build, launch, and optimize campaigns that book calls—without me thinking about deliverability or campaign management? If yes, you're succeeding.



Who This Is Perfect For



You're perfect for this if:

- You've run cold
 campaigns end-to-end before

- You understand deliverability deeply (not just theoretically)

- You can think strategically about ICP and targeting

- You write clear, effective cold
s that get replies

- You own outcomes, not just complete tasks

- You work independently and figure things out

- You're comfortable with tools like Instantly, Apollo, Clay



This is NOT for you if:

- You're a beginner who wants to learn cold

- You're a generic VA or assistant

- You only know theory, not hands-on execution

- You need step-by-step instructions for everything

- You can't maintain deliverability

- You're looking for hourly or task-based work

- You prioritize speed over deliverability



Requirements & Traits



Primary Requirements:

- Proven hands-on experience - You've run cold
 campaigns end-to-end before

- Deep deliverability knowledge - DNS, SPF, DKIM, warming, volume control

- Strategic thinking - You think about ICP and targeting, not just volume

- Strong written English - You write
s that get replies

- High ownership - You own outcomes, not just tasks

- Independent execution - You figure things out without hand-holding



Tools You Must Know:

- Instantly (mandatory)

- Apollo, Clay, Smartlead, or similar (required)

-
 infrastructure setup and management (required)



What We'll Provide:

- Access to tools and platforms

- Business goals and context

- Feedback on results



What We Won't Provide:

- Step-by-step instructions on how to run campaigns

- Hand-holding through deliverability setup

- Basic training on cold
 fundamentals



Communication & Reporting



Results-Focused Communication:

- Weekly performance reports with clear metrics (booked calls, reply rates, deliverability health)

- Proactive communication when deliverability is at risk (immediate) or campaigns need attention

- Clear, concise reporting—no busywork



Ownership:

- When you own something, you see it through to completion

- You don't wait for direction—you take initiative

- You think ahead and anticipate problems

- You optimize campaigns independently



Critical: If deliverability is at risk or campaigns are underperforming, you must communicate immediately. Deliverability is the #1 priority—never compromise it. Burning domains or reckless scaling is unacceptable.



What We Offer



Monthly salary: $450-$700/month USD (based on proven experience and results)

- Starting closer to $450 for most

- Performance-based increases after 60-90 days based on results and ownership

- Fully remote position with flexible hours

- Long-term position with growth potential as we scale

- Direct access to founder—you'll work closely with me



Why This Salary Range?

This reflects intermediate specialist expertise and outcome ownership for a part-time role. You're paid for taking responsibility for cold
 campaigns that book calls—not for hours worked. This is a long-term relationship, not short-term execution. Monthly salary shows commitment from both sides. As we grow, your responsibilities and compensation will grow with us.



Note: Filipino workers typically receive a 13th month bonus (one month's salary paid in December, pro-rated for first year). We'll discuss this during salary negotiation.



How to Apply



IMPORTANT: Please include the word 
555" at the end of your application subject line so we know you read this posting carefully.



Please include:

- Your resume/CV

- A brief cover letter explaining:

  - Your hands-on experience running cold
 campaigns end-to-end

  - Your understanding of deliverability (be specific)

  - Examples of campaigns you've run and results you've achieved

  - Why you're interested in this type of role (outcome ownership, not task completion)

- Your salary expectations within our range ($450-$700/month)

- Your availability (timezone, general availability for communication)

- Confirmation that you understand this is a part-time role (10-20 hours/week) and can commit to that



Bonus (optional but encouraged):

In 3–5 bullet points, briefly describe how you would set up a cold
 campaign from scratch (ICP definition through live campaigns) without further instructions.



What We're Looking For in Applications:

- Clear evidence of hands-on cold
 experience (not just theory)

- Specific examples of campaigns and results

- Understanding of deliverability (not just surface-level knowledge)

- Evidence of ownership and independent execution

- Understanding that this is part-time (10-20 hours/week), not full-time

- Attention to detail (did you include 
555" in the subject?)

title: Operations Assistant (Generalist – Content & Execution | Long-Term Growth Role)
description:
Overview



Long-Term Growth Role

This is a full-time, long-term role designed to grow with the business. Compensation increases are tied to demonstrated ownership, autonomy, and impact — not tenure. As the business scales and your scope expands, pay will increase accordingly.



I’m a content agency founder in the early stages. I need a generalist operations assistant who can handle execution now and evolve into coordination as we scale. Your job is to own content operations end-to-end so I can focus on strategy, content creation, and revenue.



In plain English: this role exists to take content execution completely off my plate. If you do your job well, I should think about content *less*, not more.



Long-term, this role is designed to become my right hand for content execution and coordination.



Why “Operations Assistant”? This title reflects execution + ownership. You’re not an Executive Assistant (no calendar management or admin work). You’re not a Manager (you coordinate work, you do not manage people). You’re a generalist operator who owns outcomes and removes mental load fro
.



What this means: You’re a GENERALIST who handles many things early and coordinates later. We’re early-stage. Specialists (editors, designers) may not always be available, so you’ll handle basic execution early on. As we hire specialists, your role transitions to coordinating them.



Your primary job is to get content published, distributed, tracked, and organized—without me having to think about it.



Critical clarifications:

- You coordinate work, you do not manage people.

- You execute strategy; you do not create it.

- This is an operator role, not an administrative VA role.



This isn’t a task-taker role. It’s a high-agency position where you’ll make judgment calls, solve problems independently, and own outcomes under ambiguity and incomplete instructions. You don’t own strategy or creative direction — but you are expected to use judgment daily in execution. Most importantly, you’ll communicate clearly and consistently so I can trust you’re handling everything.



The ONE Thing You Must Own First



Content Operations End-to-End



From the 
nt I hand you an edited video, graphic, or piece of content, you own it until it’s published and tracked. This means:



- Publishing - Get content live on all required platforms on schedule

- Distribution - Handle cross-posting, scheduling, and platform-specific formatting

- Tracking - Maintain records of what’s published where, when, and how it performed

- Quality Control - Review everything before it goes live (catch errors, formatting issues, broken links)

- Organization - Keep assets, files, and publishing records organized and accessible



The goal: I should be able to hand you a finished asset and trust that it will be published correctly, on time, and tracked—without me checking in or managing the process.



Once you’ve proven you can own this completely, we’ll expand your responsibilities (see “How This Role Evolves” below).



Early-Stage Reality: What You’ll Do vs. What You’ll Evolve Into



Early On (When Specialists Aren’t Always Available):

As a generalist, you will handle basic execution tasks:

- Basic script writing (often AI-assisted, with my direction on hooks and structure)

- Light content adjustments and refinements

- Quality control and final checks before publishing

- Handling basic execution early (scripts, uploads, coordination)



**What You Will NOT Be Doing:**

- Deep creative strategy or brand positioning

- Professional video editing (we hire video editors for this)

- Professional graphic design (we hire designers for this)

- Making final brand or positioning decisions



Important: I own strategy, creative direction, and final content decisions. You own execution and operations.



Secondary Responsibilities (Earned Through Ownership)



You’ll earn these responsibilities by proving ownership first. These emphasize owning outcomes, not completing tasks. You’ll learn tools and workflows quickly because you own the results:



Client Operations (after content operations is mastered)

- Own client onboarding from start to finish

- Own deliverables and timelines

- Own routine client communications



Team Coordination (as we hire specialists)

- Coordinate with video editors, designers, and other contractors

- Own quality standards enforcement (you’re not managing people—you’re coordinating work)

- Own workflows and handoffs



Systems & Documentation (ongoing)

- Own process documentation as you execute

- Own bottleneck identification and improvements

- Own systems that scale as we grow



Hiring Support (after trust is established - MAY assist, not guaranteed)

- May assist with hiring coordination (posting jobs, filtering applicants, running trials)

- May assist with onboarding new tea
mbers



The key: You earn these by demonstrating ownership of content operations first. These responsibilities are earned through ownership, not promised upfront. This role MAY assist with hiring coordination and quality control later—but this does NOT imply immediate people management, authority over tea
mbers, or strategic decision-making.



How This Role Evolves



Phase 1 (First 30-60 Days):

- Own content operations end-to-end

- Own publishing, distribution, and tracking completely

- Handle basic execution tasks when specialists aren’t available (script writing, light adjustments)

- Document processes as you learn them

- Prove you can operate independently



Phase 2 (As We Hire Specialists):

- Own coordination with video editors, designers, and other contractors

- Own client operations and onboarding

- Own quality standards enforcement across the team

- Own bottleneck identification and solutions



Phase 3 (After Trust Is Established):

- May assist with hiring coordination and onboarding (earned, not guaranteed)

- Own central operations across the content engine (coordinating work, not managing people)

- Own strategic execution (executing initiatives I’ve outlined, not creating strategy)



What Always Stays With Me (The Founder):

- Strategy and business direction

- Creative direction and content ideas

- Final brand decisions and positioning

- Client relationship strategy

- Revenue and business model decisions



How Growth Happens:

Growth comes through demonstrated ownership, reliability, and initiative—not promises or titles. You’re paid for ownership and reliability, not seniority or titles. You make daily judgment calls within execution and operate under ambiguity and incomplete instructions. The role grows organically based on what you can actually handle. If this works long-term, this role can evolve into a senior operations or content coordination position.



Who This Is Perfect For



You’re perfect for this if:

- You thrive on ownership and responsibility

- You handle ambiguity and make judgment calls without constant direction

- You’re organized, proactive, and think in systems

- You communicate clearly and consistently (this is critical)

- You want to grow with a business and take on more responsibility over time

- You balance multiple priorities and shifting deadlines

- You’re okay doing basic execution early on, knowing you’ll evolve into coordination



This is NOT for you if:

- You need detailed step-by-step instructions for everything

- You prefer to wait for direction rather than take initiative

- You struggle with ambiguity or changing priorities

- You want to be a pure specialist (editor, designer, strategist)

- You’re looking for a simple task-completion role

- You want to focus only on creative work (this is operations-focused)

- You want a title more than responsibility

- You’re uncomfortable with ambiguity and incomplete instructions



Requirements & Traits



Primary Requirements (What We’re Hiring For - Core Criteria):

- Ownership and reliability - You take responsibility for outcomes, not just tasks. You show up every day and follow through.

- Strong English communication (written and spoken) - This is non-negotiable

- High agency mindset - You figure things out before asking (but you do ask when stuck)

- Attention to detail - You catch mistakes and inconsistencies

- Proactive problem-solving - You think ahead and anticipate needs



What We’re NOT Looking For:

- Prior mastery of our specific tools or processes (we’ll teach you)

- Years of experience in content operations (ownership matters more)

- A long list of specialist skills (we’re hiring for mindset and execution, not experience breadth)



Early-Stage Skills (Valuable But Not Required):

- Basic script writing ability (often AI-assisted)

- Basic understanding of what makes content perform (hooks, retention, virality)

- Light content adjustment and refinement skills

- Experience with content management, publishing, or operations

- Familiarity with social media platforms and scheduling tools



Note: You are not expected to be an expert in everything. You are expected to figure things out and communicate clearly. These early-stage skills are helpful but not required. We’re primarily hiring for ownership and reliability. You’ll learn tools and workflows quickly because you own outcomes, not just complete tasks.



What We’ll Teach You:

- Our specific workflows and publishing processes

- Our tools and systems

- Our quality standards and expectations

- How we want things done



What We Can’t Teach:

- Ownership mindset

- Proactive communication

- Judgment and decision-making

- Reliability and consistency



30-Day Success Definition



By day 30, you will:

- Own all publishing and distribution without me checking

- Own tracking all published content accurately

- Own catching quality issues before content goes live

- Own daily communication without me having to ask

- Own making judgment calls on routine publishing decisions

- Own documenting processes as you execute them



The test: Can I hand you a finished asset and trust it will be published correctly, on time, and tracked—without me thinking about it? If yes, you’re succeeding.



Communication, Ownership, and Feedback Expectations



Daily Communication (MANDATORY):

- Daily Slack communication is mandatory

- You’ll send a daily update via Slack covering:

- What you completed today

- What problems you ran into (and how you solved them or need help)

- What you need fro
 (if anything)

- This isn’t micromanagement—it’s accountability and visibility

- Visibility and accountability matter more than speed

- Disappearing when stuck is unacceptable



Ownership:

- When you own something, you see it through to completion

- You don’t disappear when you get stuck—you communicate the problem

- You think ahead and anticipate needs

- You take initiative to improve processes



Feedback:

- I’ll give you direct, honest feedback to help you succeed

- You should ask questions when unclear, not guess

- We’ll iterate on processes together

- The goal is continuous improvement, not perfection on day one



Critical: If you get stuck on something, you must tell me. Disappearing when stuck is the #1 reason these relationships fail. I’m here to help you succeed—but I can’t help if I don’t know there’s a problem.



What We Offer



- Monthly salary: $800-$1,100/month USD (based on ownership demonstrated, not years of experience)

- Starting closer to $800 for most

- Increases based on trust, autonomy, and results

- Salary review after 90 days with opportunity for increase

- Fully remote position with flexible hours

- Long-term position with growth potential as we scale

- Opportunity to build systems and processes from the ground up

- Direct access to founder—you’ll work closely with me



Why This Salary Range?

Higher pay reflects ownership, judgment, and reliability—not seniority or titles. This is not paid like a task-based VA role. You’re paid for taking responsibility, making judgment calls, and removing mental load fro
. We’re looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a freelancer. Monthly salary shows commitment from both sides. As we grow, your responsibilities and compensation will grow with us.



Note: Filipino workers typically receive a 13th month bonus (one month’s salary paid in December, pro-rated for first year). We’ll discuss this during salary negotiation.



How to Apply



Please include the word “OPS555” at the end of your application subject line so we know you read this posting carefully.



Please include:

- Your resume/CV

- A brief cover letter explaining:

- Why you’re interested in this type of role (high-agency, execution-focused operations)

- An example of a time you took ownership of something ambiguous and figured it out

- How you handle multiple priorities and shifting deadlines

- Your salary expectations within our range ($800-$1,100/month)

- Your availability (hours per week, timezone)

- Confirmation that you can communicate daily via Slack

- One question you have about this role



Bonus (optional but encouraged):



In 3–5 bullet points, briefly describe how you would take a finished video file and get it published across multiple platforms end-to-end without further instructions.



What We’re Looking For in Applications:

- Clear, professional English communication

- Evidence of ownership and initiative (not just task completion)

- Understanding that this is an execution/operations role where you use judgment daily

- Attention to detail (did you include “OPS555” in the subject?)

title: Business Development Associate
description:
About the Role:

We are a growing portfolio of online media brands serving engaged audiences across meaningful niches including mental health, personal development, and wellness. Our digital newsletters reach hundreds of thousands of readers daily, delivering valuable content that helps people live better lives.



We are seeking a motivated Business Development Associate to join our team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building and nurturing strategic partnerships that amplify our brands, expand our reach, and drive revenue through sponsorships and collaborative marketing initiatives. You will work closely with our marketing and product development teams to identify opportunities, close deals, and maintain long-term partner relationships.





What You’ll Be Doing:

1. Partnership Development: Identify, prospect, and secure new sponsorship and partnership opportunities for our digital newsletters and media brands.

2. Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with sponsors, partners, and collaborators to ensure mutual success and repeat business.

3. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing and product development teams to align partnership strategies with brand goals and campaign objectives.

4. Trust-Building Initiatives: Support the development of marketing activities that enhance brand credibility and audience trust through strategic collaborations.

5. Deal Negotiation: Lead negotiations with potential partners and sponsors, ensuring favorable terms that align with company objectives.

6. Market Research: Stay informed on industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging partnership opportunities within the digital media and newsletter space.



Requirements:

- Minimum 2 years of experience in business development, partnerships, sales, or a related field.

- Fluent English communication skills, both written and verbal (required).

- Proven track record of identifying, negotiating, and closing partnership or sponsorship deals.

- Strong relationship-building skills with the ability to manage multiple partner accounts simultaneously.

title: Commercial Support Executive (Remote)
description:
About the company

At Miraco Nutripharm, we are dedicated to advancing health and improving lives. Our goal is to relieve 1 billion people worldwide of pain and discomfort. If you know of anyone who has been worried about or suffered from any health problems, join us in making a positive impact by reducing the pain and distress others have to endure.



Job description

As the Commercial Support Executive, you will be responsible for supporting a broad range of commercial tasks within the organisation. This includes/will include customer service, order processing, maintaining sales call sheets and supporting operational workflows through process documentation and improvement as well as research and analysis to achieve business stability and growth. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of commercial processes and be an agile multi-tasker with strong organisational and problem-solving skills. 



Key Responsibilities:



Customer Experience

- Sales order processing with our ERP system

- Collaborate with Operations and Fulfilment team to ensure timely enquiries handling, order processing and delivery 

- Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with customers

- Onboard new customers, ensuring a smooth transition and successful implementation

- Maintain accurate records of client interactions and progress in ERP & CRM tools

- Analyze customer data and feedback to improve services and retention strategies

- Act as the voice of the customer internally to advocate for their needs and feedback while taking into account business objectives 

- Monitor customer health scores and proactively address any issues or risks

- Monitor and manage regional e-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopee, Lazada) to ensure product listings are accurate, compliant, and authorised.

- Review account performance metrics and sales value regularly to track growth trends and identify opportunities.

- Proactively recommend strategies to strengthen account potential, optimise visibility, and drive incremental sales across channels.

- Maintain and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for smooth and stable daily operations across different departments 

- Identify and improve areas to increase operational efficiencies and business workflows to optimise resource utilisation  

- Collaborate with sales, marketing, and support teams to deliver an excellent customer experience

- Implement seamless and impactful customer journeys across our multi-store eCommerce website (B2C & B2B), CRM loyalty programs and official marketplace store (Shopee & Lazada)

- Optimize customer interactions across touchpoints to increase satisfaction, loyalty and lifetime value, while collaborating closely with digital & marketing, sales and IT teams.

- Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities in coordination with the sales team



Commercial Administrative Support

- Assist in researching and/or compiling information to support various business functions

- Work cross functionally and support management in scheduling, tracking project milestones and monitoring deliverables to ensure business goals are successfully met 

- Provide administrative and operational support as required



Requirements:

- Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualification

- Computer literacy with knowledge of Google Drive and MS Office applications

- Minimum 2 years of remote work experience

- Ideally with experience working with ERP & CRM systems

- Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment 

- Strong attention to detail, problem-solving and communication skills

- Effective time management and organisational skills while being adaptable and proactive to initiate process changes

- High levels of integrity and professionalism



To submit your application, please send your CV to

title: Amazon Brand Manager
description:
We are a Canadian-based company that has recently launched a new Amazon brand after the successful divestiture of an 8-figure Amazon business.  We are starting from scratch again and looking to rapidly grow another Global Amazon business.

This is a rare opportunity for a very talented Brand Manager to join a new, well-financed Amazon brand at the ground-floor stage and help shape everything from product direction to brand identity. If you’re entrepreneurial, hands-on, experienced, and thrive in fast-moving environments, you’ll love leveraging your talents on this brand.



The Brand Manager role is dedicated to ensuring that our brand processes on the Amazon platform are consistent, on-brand, and leverage current best practices. This individual will require extensive Amazon experience and will work closely with the company Founder to proactively manage and grow the business.  We respectfully request that you do not apply if you do not have extensive Amazon experience.



This role has three primary focuses: Listing Optimization and Store Design (Including A+ Content); Catalog, Account Health, and Seller Support Management; and Customer Service.



This role has three secondary focuses: Product Launch, Product Development, and PPC Management.

Recent experience with AI is a benefit.



The Brand Manager must have the following skills:

1. Must be a problem solver who requires little oversight. You possess the drive to find solutions that align with the organization’s goals and objectives. You must be a self-starter.

2. Excellent proficiency in English with strong communication and writing skills.

3. Excellent understanding of and experience with the Amazon platform. Multiple years of experience are mandatory.

4. Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, with keen attention to detail.

5. Thinks like a Manager – develops and follows standard operating procedures, enshrines best practises into processes, and strives for operational excellence.



If you’re a high-performing Brand Manager looking for an opportunity to make a real mark, this is it. You’ll be joining at the beginning—helping set strategy, build 
ntum, and grow a brand from the ground up.

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT - Marketing
description:
About NordStick



NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand. It is a long term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.



The Role



We are hiring a Marketing Focused Executive Assistant to directly support the Founder and marketing team.

This is not a basic admin position. You are not here to just manage calendars or take notes.

You are here to reduce friction, create leverage, and make sure marketing execution actually ships on time.

Campaigns, launches,
s, creator partnerships, assets, reporting. If something breaks or stalls, you fix it or escalate it before it becomes a problem.



If you wait for instructions, this role will feel stressful. If you naturally spot gaps and solve them without being asked, you will thrive.

Approximately 60% of your time will support marketing execution and coordination, with the rest focused on systems, reporting, and general operational support.



Core Responsibilities



Execution Support and Ownership

--> Support the Founder and marketing team across campaigns, launches, and growth initiatives

 --> Turn direction into clear tasks, timelines, and deliverables

 --> Track priorities, deadlines, and dependencies across teams

 --> Follow up relentlessly to ensure nothing slips



Marketing Operations and Systems

--> Assist with
 marketing setup and QA using tools like Klaviyo

 --> Support Shopify store updates, landing pages, and customer journey testing

 --> Coordinate with designers, media buyers, affiliates, and partners to keep projects moving

 --> Organize marketing assets, content libraries, and documentation

 --> Leverage AI tools to speed up research, content, and workflows



Data and Reporting

--> Maintain Google Sheets for tracking campaigns, sales, and performance

 --> Build simple reports to monitor results and highlight issues or opportunities

 --> Analyze data to help inform decisions and next steps

 --> Flag problems early before they impact revenue



Communication and Coordination

--> Prepare agendas, notes, and action items for check ins

 --> Keep internal communication tight, clear, and actionable

 --> Create simple SOPs and workflows where needed

 --> Act as a central point of coordination across marketing efforts



What Success Looks Like



Within 30 Days

--> Marketing tasks are organized and clearly tracked

 --> Tools and systems are clean and reliable

 --> Founder is not chasing updates or reminders



Within 90 Days

--> Campaigns launch smoothly and on time

 --> Reporting is consistent and data driven

 --> Marketing feels proactive, not reactive

 --> Leadership focuses on strategy, not cleanup



Requirements



You should not apply unless most of the following are true:

--> You have supported founders or fast moving teams before

 --> You are extremely organized and detail oriented

 --> You take initiative and solve problems without being told

 --> You communicate clearly and directly

 --> You are comfortable with Shopify, Google Sheets, and marketing tools

 --> You are confident using AI tools to improve speed and output

 --> You enjoy execution and follow through, not just ideas

 --> You can commit full time, working 40 hours per week



How to Apply

Send a message with:

--> Your resume

 --> A brief overview of why you are a strong fit for this role

 --> Examples of marketing or project coordination work you have supported

Keep it short and specific.

title: Video Editor - Long-Form YouTube Content
description:
Video Editor - Long-Form YouTube (Per Project)



Job Title



Video Editor - Long-Form YouTube Content



Job Type



Project-based (per video) – ongoing work, long-term collaboration

Remote position

Payment: Per project. You set your price per video in your application.



About Us



We are a growing content agency creating long-form YouTube content for digital businesses. We need a Video Editor who can take raw footage (including talking head and other formats) and deliver polished long-form YouTube videos in two distinct editing styles. This is a long-term role with consistent volume as we scale.



What We Care About Most



More than your tools or years of experience, we care about your integrity, commitment, and ability to match a style brief. We’re looking for someone who shows up on time, follows through on commitments, pays attention to reference examples, and wants to grow with our business. You must be able to edit in both of the styles we use—not just one.



Position Overview



You’ll be responsible for:

- Editing long-form YouTube videos (typically 8–25+ minutes) in two distinct styles

- Matching the pacing, cuts, graphics, and feel of each style based on reference examples we provide

- Working from raw footage (which may include talking head segments, screen recordings, B-roll, and other assets)

- Delivering consistent quality, clear audio, and strong retention-friendly structure

- Meeting agreed deadlines and turnaround times

- Communicating clearly in English (written and, when needed, short calls)



Content type: Long-form YouTube only. We do not need short-form (Reels/TikTok/Shorts) for this role.



Volume: We have ongoing long-form video needs. Work is assigned per project; volume will grow as we add more channels and clients.



Editing Style Examples (Required Review)



We use two different long-form YouTube styles. You must be able to edit in both.



Style 1 – Example video:







Style 2 – Example video:







Please watch both examples in full before applying. In your application, briefly confirm you’ve watched them and describe how your experience fits each style (e.g. pacing, graphics, use of B-roll, chapter structure). Applications that don’t reference these two examples will not be considered.



What We’re Looking For



- A strong understanding of retention in video editing (required)

- Experience editing long-form YouTube (or similar) content – portfolio required

- Ability to match a given style from reference videos (both styles above)

- Strong English communication (written; occasional short calls)

- Reliable and consistent – we need someone we can count on for deadlines



We can teach you our exact workflows, file naming, and delivery process. We can’t teach reliability, attention to reference, or the ability to replicate a style. If you have long-form YouTube editing experience and a portfolio that shows style flexibility, we want to hear from you.



Portfolio required. Applications without portfolio links (preferably YouTube links to long-form videos you’ve edited) will not be considered.



What We Offer



- Per-project payment – you quote your price per video in your application (e.g. per 10-min video, or per finished minute; state your rate clearly)

- Ongoing work as we scale – consistent projects for the right editor

- Fully remote, flexible hours

- Long-term collaboration with growth potential



Hiring process: After initial screening, we’ll ask shortlisted candidates to complete one paid test edit (we’ll provide raw footage and a style reference). This lets us evaluate your ability to match our styles and your working process before we agree on ongoing rates.



How to Apply



IMPORTANT: Start your application subject line with the word “LONG555” so we know you read this posting.



Please include:

- Your resume/CV

- A portfolio link (REQUIRED) – preferably long-form YouTube videos you’ve edited

- A short cover letter that:

- Confirms you’ve watched both style example videos above

- Briefly explains how your experience fits each style

- Your per-project rate (e.g. $X per video, or $X per finished minute – state clearly how you price long-form edits)

- Your availability (timezone and typical turnaround per video)

- How many long-form videos per week you can comfortably deliver while maintaining quality



We need a long-form YouTube editor who can deliver in both of our styles, on time and to a high standard. If you’re reliable, detail-oriented, and able to match reference styles, we want to hear from you.

title: AFFILIATE MANAGER
description:
AFFILIATE MANAGER



NordStick



NordStick is a leading fitness brand founded in 2020 by a prominent physical therapist, dedicated to innovative home based workout solutions that help people overcome pain, prevent injuries, and achieve peak performance. Our flagship products, like the NordStick and NordBench Pro, are affordable, high quality, and multifunctional, empowering over 250,000 customers to build strength and improve mobility without a gym. As part of a fast growing DTC fitness ecosystem, we're committed to making health and wellness accessible. This is not a lifestyle brand. It is a long term company with high expectations around execution, ownership, and reliability.



The Role



We are hiring an Affiliate Manager to own and scale NordStick’s creator and affiliate partnerships.

This is not a passive “send a few
s and hope someone posts” role. You are responsible for building a real revenue channel through creators and partners.



You will identify the right people, reach out, close partnerships, manage deliverables, track performance, and make sure affiliates actually drive results.



If you need constant direction, this role will feel overwhelming. If you naturally spot opportunities, follow through, and treat outcomes like they’re your own business, you will thrive.



You will operate across marketing, ecommerce, and operations, working directly with the Founder and internal team to turn partnerships into consistent growth.



Core Responsibilities



1. Affiliate Strategy and Outreach

--> Lead creator research and qualification across Instagram,
, and YouTube, focusing on U.S. based influencers and affiliates who align with the brand

 --> Manage outbound and inbound creator outreach and prospecting

 --> Build and maintain a consistent pipeline of high quality partners

 --> Draft and manage partnership agreements and contracts



2. Partner Onboarding and Execution

--> Own partner onboarding including whitelisting setup, expectations alignment, and launch timelines

 --> Coordinate product seeding and create orders for affiliates

 --> Track and manage creator deliverables throughout each phase of the campaign

 --> Act as the primary point of contact for partners across the full lifecycle



3. Operations and Performance Management

--> Maintain and manage partnership workflows and tasks in Asana

 --> Generate and analyze performance reports for affiliate campaigns

 --> Track affiliate payouts and ensure timely and accurate compensation

 --> Identify what is working, what is not, and proactively optimize for better results



What Success Looks Like



Within 30 Days

--> Active pipeline of qualified creators and affiliates

 --> Outreach and onboarding systems clearly organized and repeatable

 --> First partnerships launched without hand holding



Within 90 Days

--> Affiliate channel driving consistent and measurable revenue

 --> Partners managed proactively with clear expectations and accountability

 --> Reporting is reliable, data driven, and used to guide decisions

 --> Founder is not chasing follow ups, payments, or missed deliverables



Requirements



You should not apply unless most of the following are true:

--> You have managed affiliate, influencer, or creator partnerships for ecommerce or DTC brands

 --> You are highly organized and comfortable juggling multiple relationships and timelines

 --> You are proactive and take ownership without waiting for instructions

 --> You communicate clearly and directly with partners and internal teams

 --> You are comfortable negotiating agreements and setting expectations

 --> You can analyze performance data and translate it into actions

 --> You have experience with tools like Asana, Shopify, Google Sheets, and affiliate or tracking platforms

 --> You understand how creators, paid media, and ecommerce work together to drive sales

 --> You can commit full time, working 40 hours per week



How to Apply



Send a message with:

--> Your resume

 --> A brief overview of why you are a strong fit for this role

 --> Any relevant experience managing affiliates, influencers, or creator campaigns
